law.catch_line: Commission On Falls Prevention; Members; Duties

text.section: consider strategies to improve data collection and analysis to identify fall risk, health care cost data and protective factors;
consider strategies to improve the identification of older adults who have a high risk of falling;
consider strategies to maximize the dissemination of proven, effective fall prevention interventions and identify barriers to those interventions;
assess the risk and measure the incidence of falls occurring in various settings;
identify evidence-based strategies used by long-term care providers to reduce the rate of falls among older adults and reduce the rate of hospitalizations related to such falls;
identify evidence-based community programs designed to prevent falls among older adults;
review falls prevention initiatives for community-based settings; and

examine the components and key elements of the above falls prevention initiatives, consider their applicability in the commonwealth and develop strategies for pilot testing, implementation and evaluation.
intervention approaches, including physical activity, medication assessment and reduction of medication when possible, vision enhancement and home-modification strategies;
strategies that promote collaboration between the medical community, including physicians, long-term care providers and pharmacists to reduce the rate of falls among their patients;

programs that are targeted to fall victims who are at a high risk for second falls and that are designed to maximize independence and quality of life for older adults, particularly those older adults with functional limitations;
programs that encourage partnerships to prevent falls among older adults and prevent or reduce injuries when falls occur; and

programs to encourage long-term care providers to implement falls- prevention strategies which use specific interventions to help all patients avoid the risks for falling in an effort to reduce hospitalizations and prolong a high quality of life.
